description: The Connector Layer subsystem provides a robust and standardized mechanism for the MCPClient to interact with various external MCP servers and tools. It acts as a crucial abstraction layer, enabling protocol-agnostic communication. At its core, the BaseConnector defines a common interface for all communication protocols, ensuring consistency and extensibility. Concrete implementations, such as WebSocketConnector and HTTPConnector, extend this base to handle specific protocol intricacies, facilitating real-time and traditional request-response interactions for the MCPClient.

components.name: Connector Layer
components.description: The overarching subsystem providing a standardized, protocol-agnostic mechanism for the `MCPClient` to communicate with diverse external `MCP servers` and tools. It acts as the entry point for establishing and managing connections.

components.name: BaseConnector
components.description: Defines the abstract interface and common contract for all concrete connectors. It establishes fundamental operations for connecting, sending requests, and receiving responses, ensuring a consistent API across different communication protocols. This component is crucial for extensibility and adherence to the Adapter Pattern.

components.name: WebSocketConnector
components.description: Implements the `BaseConnector` interface specifically for WebSocket-based communication. It handles the intricacies of WebSocket connections, including establishing, maintaining, closing, and managing asynchronous message exchange, vital for real-time agent interactions.

components.name: HTTPConnector
components.description: Implements the `BaseConnector` interface for HTTP-based communication. It manages the sending of HTTP requests and processing of HTTP responses, handling various HTTP methods and status codes, suitable for traditional request-response interactions with `MCP Servers`.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
